intro: Cassine humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's cassine, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish bark and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces elongated, oval berries that are typically reddish when mature. Cassine humbertii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
